fullName.value: Membrane-associated tyrosine- and threonine-specific cdc2-inhibitory kinase

texts.value: Acts as a negative regulator of entry into mitosis (G2 to M transition) by phosphorylation of the CDK1 kinase specifically when CDK1 is complexed to cyclins (PubMed:10373560, PubMed:10504341, PubMed:9001210, PubMed:9268380). Mediates phosphorylation of CDK1 predominantly on 'Thr-14'. Also involved in Golgi fragmentation (PubMed:9001210, PubMed:9268380). May be involved in phosphorylation of CDK1 on 'Tyr-15' to a lesser degree, however tyrosine kinase activity is unclear and may be indirect (PubMed:9001210, PubMed:9268380)

Negatively regulated by hyperphosphorylation during mitosis (PubMed:9268380). The hyperphosphorylated form does not associate with CCNB1-CDC2 complexes (PubMed:9268380). The PLK1 protein kinase may be required for mitotic phosphorylation (PubMed:9268380)
Interacts with CDC2-CCNB1 complex. Can also interact with PIN1 when phosphorylated by CDC2-CCNB1

The membrane-association motif is essential for the localization to membrane of Golgi stack (PubMed:10504341). According to some authors, it is a transmembrane domain; the existence of a transmembrane region is however unproven (PubMed:10504341)
Autophosphorylated. Phosphorylated by CDC2-CCNB1 complexes on undefined serine and threonine residues. The phosphorylation by CDC2-CCNB1 complexes may inhibit the catalytic activity
Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. Ser/Thr protein kinase family. WEE1 subfamily

features.description: Membrane-associated tyrosine- and threonine-specific cdc2-inhibitory kinase

citation.title: Human Myt1 is a cell cycle-regulated kinase that inhibits Cdc2 but not Cdk2 activity.
The human Myt1 kinase preferentially phosphorylates Cdc2 on threonine 14 and localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum and Golgi complex.
Complete sequencing and characterization of 21,243 full-length human cDNAs.
The sequence and analysis of duplication-rich human chromosome 16.
The full-ORF clone resource of the German cDNA consortium.
The essential mitotic peptidyl-prolyl isomerase Pin1 binds and regulates mitosis-specific phosphoproteins.
The C-terminal domain of the Cdc2 inhibitory kinase Myt1 interacts with Cdc2 complexes and is required for inhibition of G(2)/M progression.
Overproduction of human Myt1 kinase induces a G2 cell cycle delay by interfering with the intracellular trafficking of Cdc2-cyclin B1 complexes.
Identification of a consensus motif for Plk (Polo-like kinase) phosphorylation reveals Myt1 as a Plk1 substrate.
Kinase-selective enrichment enables quantitative phosphoproteomics of the kinome across the cell cycle.
